releases/0/tender/title: Strategic Leisure Partner for Fitness Equipment Provision
releases/0/tender/description: Mid Devon District Council is committed to providing a market leading leisure experience; exciting times with a Â£0.9M extension to Exe Valley Leisure Centre currently underway. To reflect our aspiration for the future we want more than an equipment supplier; we want a strategic leisure partner. A partner that can help us stay at the forefront of a fast moving industry. We want this to be a true partnership that maximises the opportunity at our existing three leisure centres and creates capacity to seek new opportunities. This notice articulates the core offer; yet it is clear we expect our partner to work with us on new opportunities within the framework of our strategic partnership.   Please register your interest on contract reference DN285799 via www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk

releases/0/tender/title: SMARTLINE Project - Supply of Sensors and Data Collection System
releases/0/tender/description:
This invitation to tender is to provide the following hardware and services

A standard set of sensors for 350 households, to include the following:
Temperature sensors, Humidity sensors, Air Quality sensors

Utility monitoring sensors (Gas, Electric and Water)

An enhanced set of sensors for a subset of 50-150 homes 

Additional external sensors as identified 

A data collection service is required to quality control and store the data for supply to a data integration system. 

Provide a demonstration of the equipment at the University of Exeter premises.

Please see the document suite for full details.

Greater Manchester Combined Authority as the Contracting Authority for Greater Manchester Police is tendering for the provision of a Building Services Maintenance and Installation service.
The contract will cover PPM and Reactive Maintenance including capital projects in the event that replacement installations are required. The contract will include all major mechanical assets such as Boiler Plant, Ventilation Air Handling Plant, Air Conditioning Plant and Fan Coil Units, Building Management Systems and stand-alone Control Systems. Plus routine Statutory Inspection of all associated equipment. Please refer to the specification for more details.

The contract will be subject to GMP Terms and Conditions.

FOR AN INITIAL PERIOD OF 3 YEARS WITH THE OPTION TO EXTEND FOR A FURTHER 2 YEARS (EITHER INCREMENTALLY OR AS A SINGLE EXTENSION) SUBJECT TO PERFORMANCE, VALUE FOR MONEY AND ONGOING OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS.

Estimated Value Â£1,200,000 Per annum (including project work) Projects are subject to requirement.

NO VOLUME OR VALUE of orders will be guaranteed in respect of this contract.
releases/0/tender/additionalClassificati: Repair and maintenance services of electrical and mechanical building installations

releases/0/tender/description:
The successful Supplier will be required to provide cleaning services at the Gilberd School based in Colchester. 
      
      Gilberd School is a mixed 11-16 comprehensive school of currently 1,463 students rising to 1,620 within the next 3 years. The school was formed in 1958 but moved to its current site in 1980 where a vast amount of expansion has taken place to accommodate the increasing student roll.  The school is currently rated Good by Ofsted with aspirations to being an Outstanding school.  All the school buildings are contained within the boundaries of one site in the centre of the Highwoods development in the centre of Colchester. 
      
      The school has many excellent facilities including a new sports hall to add to the existing one, gym, a Performing Arts block, as well as well-maintained other school buildings.  The Gilberd prides itself in providing an excellent environment for students that is conducive to enhanced teaching and learning.

releases/0/tender/description: To ensure realism in the training of Hazardous Area Response Team (HART) staff, NARU requires specialist actors with the ability to simulate realistic and severe trauma, including amputations. In addition to the specialist actors NARU requires make-up artists capable of replicating realistic wounds. It is the responsibility of the make-up artists to supply make-up and other ancillary equipment. The make-up artists will support and work with NARU staff who provide realistic casualty moulage

releases/0/tender/description:
A unique housing Group, Torus combines the very best of two local, community led landlords. Sound governance, a strong asset base and significant financial capacity enables us to do more. To provide more opportunities for the communities we serve, build more new homes and enhance the services we provide to our tenants and customers. On 1st April 2015, Golden Gates Housing Trust (GGHT) based in Warrington and Helena Partnerships based in St. Helen's entered into a Group Structure to form the Torus Group. 
      
      Torus Group seeks to procure suitably qualified supply chain partner(s) to provide an integrated multidisciplinary range of Hard and Soft Facilities Management services for a maximum of seven years with a contract range of Â£3m - Â£10m. The initial contract duration is three years from 1st April 2017 with options to extend twice subject to satisfactory performance, each time for two years until 31st March 2024.
